info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 1:09PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cabarrus County through 145 PM EDT... At 108 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Downtown Concord, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kannapolis, Concord, Harrisburg, Charlotte Motor Speedway and Coddle Creek Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
